lines:
February 5, 1912.

kr. S. C. Luk, 
224 North Wayne Street,

Angola, Indiana.

Ky dear Luk:

Thank you very much for your prompt reply to my letter 
of earlier date. Your letter with the inclosed check for $250. has just

been received and I am returning herewith receipt for the latter.

Don't

let the balance of this account weigh on your mind and cause you unnecessary

anxiety.

I shall be only too glad to carry the anount for you until you

can settle it with entire convenience.

I know how anxious you must be these days about the situation at

horse.

A letter only recently received from Wr. Tong indicates that in his

opinion the troubles will soon be over, and that before long conditione in

China will be free from distrubing factors.

I earnestly hope that you may

early learn that your own family and friends have not been put to any serious

inconvenience or suffered any natorial loss.

Believe me, with kindest regards,

Very sincerely yours,

Principal.
